description.description_short: Fresh Red Cayenne - the Chilli that is multipurposed
description.description_long:
Fresh Red Cayenne: A real highlight for the delicious chili cuisine ...

Now in a 300g pack

Red Cayenne to conjure up your own creations: Sugos, sauces, jams, salads, stuffed, dried ...

Cayenne chili is often used dried , It stands out with a solid pungency and stands out with a slightly bitter taste in the finish of many other chili varieties.

In addition to the Cajun cuisine in Louisiana (for gumbo and seafood dishes) Cayenne also provides the Asian Kitchen for the right spice. With its fine taste and great aroma, this variety is versatile.

Other names:

Cayenne Red, Red Cayenne, Cayenne, Red Pepper

Sharpness:

5-8

Ripening:

from green to red

Maturation:

60-65 days

Fruit:

about 70-180 mm long, diameter about 10-20 mm, thin-walled, oblong, light bent, hanging

Origin:

Mexico

Growth:

approx. 120-150 cm

Use:

drying (air drying possible).

Description:

The capital of French Guiana in South America gave this variety its name. For a long time she was also grown there. The word "Cayenne" derives from the language of the natives in this area and means something like "hot pepper". The fruits are characterized by a biting / pungent sharpness with a slightly smoky aroma. The Cayenne is known to most but probably more through the widely available cayenne pepper. But also in medicine Cayenne is used. Cayenne pepper extract is the main component of heat pots and heat ointments. The active ingredient here is capsaicin, which stimulates blood circulation at the affected site and thus promotes healing. Meanwhile, capsaicin is increasingly being obtained from varieties with a higher capsaicin concentration, e.g. Red Savina or Bhut Jolokia. Own experiences: The cayenne have grown magnificently with us, both in the field, as well as pot culture. The plants form many branches, are medium sized and have many long thin fruits. The only difference is that they grow even bushier in the field. Click here for more fresh chili varieties directly from the chilli plant: fresh chilies

Ingredients:

Our Hot Cooking # 5 recipe suggestion for you: Nachos pickled with your favorite craft beer

Delicious and long lasting these Jalapenos pickled in Craft Beer!

Ingredients:

400g Jalapenos

20 - 30 mini onions

1 cup craft beer

1 cup apple cider vinegar

3 tablespoons brown sugar

2 tablespoons salt

1 tablespoon of black peppercorns

(1 cup = approx. 200 ml, 1 tablespoon = 1 heaped tablespoon)

 

Instructions:

Wash the Jalapenos and cut into strips.

Skin the onion and layer the two in a preserving jar.

In a saucepan, add the beer, vinegar, sugar, salt and peppercorns over medium heat, stirring until sugar and salt have dissolved.

Pour the broth over the jalapenos.

Close the lid firmly and turn the glass upside down for a few minutes.

Put the whole thing in the refrigerator for 24 hours.

When properly stored, the Jalapenos will last for several weeks.

Our Hot Cooking # 9 recipe suggestion for you: Refined Stew as a hearty alternative

Simmering potato stew with a light spicy kick for the big hunger!

Ingredients:

500 g Poblano green, roasted, stalked, skinned and chopped

500g of boiled potatoes, peeled and diced

1 glass of corn kernels, drained

1 large onions, diced

2 garlic clove(s) crushed or finely chopped

3-4 tablespoons rapeseed oil

0.5 l of chicken broth

1 teaspoon oregano

Ground 1/2 teaspoon cumin

80g grated cheese, slightly melting eg. Mozzarella

 

Instructions:

Cook the onion in a medium saucepan in oil over medium heat until golden brown (about 5 minutes). Add garlic and simmer for another 1-2 minutes. Add chilies, potato cubes and corn. Fill with broth, season with oregano and cumin, stir well. Bring the pot contents to a boil, then reduce the temperature and simmer with the lid for about 30-45 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked (fork test).

 

Serve hot, sprinkle some grated cheese into each plate as you like

In the Guinness Book of Records, the Carolina Reaper is noted as the hottest chilli in the world. With great attention to detail now have exclusive access to a Capsicum Chinense with absolute extra-heat.

In the germination phase the hottest plants are selected and multiplied, the recipe for success!

Be fast now and compare this chilli to your favorite super-hot chilli

Juicy extreme-extreme-extreme heat

 

Use:

Freshly used for seasoning or dried as seasoning powder but only the smallest amounts.

 

Our Hot Cooking # 10 recipe suggestion for you: Juicy chocolate cake heavenly sweet and devilish hot

Ingredients:

  • 250 g of sugar
  • 250 g butter
  • 250 g chocolate (80%)
  • 4 eggs
  • 2 tablespoons of flour
  • 1 pinch of salt
  • ½ RachenReibe Chilli (maximum quantity, rather use less, the variety is very spicy!)

Instructions:

  1. Melt butter and chocolate in a saucepan at low temperature and stir.
  2. Mix sugar, eggs and flour with a whisk until smooth. Add a pinch of salt, as well as the finely diced RachenReibe slice. Mix everything together. Grease a springform pan (22-24 cm) and fill in the chocolate mixture.
  3. Put everything in the preheated oven at 160 ° C top / bottom heat for about. Bake for 30 minutes.

 

Looks unimpressive, but it is incredibly juicy and delicious. Sweet kick included!

Our Hot Cooking#12 Recept sugestion for you: Our favorite Chili con Carne

Instructions:

1. Dice the meat small, fry in a large pot and remove

2. Chop the onions and garlic, and fry in the pot in high heat.

3. Add minced meat and keep stirring. When the minced is brown with 200 ml of meat broth deglaze.

4. Add chilli beans, kidney beans, diced peppers, chopped tomatoes and corn. Do not drain the cans beforehand, but add everything with liquid. 

5. Simmer over low heat for about 1 hour.

6. At the end with the spices and the fresh chopped chillies, season to taste hot.
